definition:
Let $G \subset \mathbb{C}$ be a region and let $\gamma$ be a connected
subset of $\partial G$ (boundary of $G$), then $\gamma$ is a [*free
analytic boundary arc*]{} of $G$ if for every point $\zeta \in \gamma$
there is a neighbourhood $U$ of $\zeta$ and a conformal equivalence
$h \colon {\mathbb{D}} \to U$ (where ${\mathbb{D}}$ is the unit disc)
such that $h(0) = \zeta$, $h(-1,1) = \gamma \cap U$ and
$h({\mathbb{D}}_+) = G \cap U$ (where ${\mathbb{D}}_+$ is all the points
in the unit disc with non-negative imaginary part).

[9]{} John B. Conway. [**]{}. Springer-Verlag, New York, New York, 1995.
